intro: Xanthocephalum longipappum, commonly known as the long-pappus goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, and it has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Xanthocephalum longipappum is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
